data.title: XAU/USD: Gold Hits Multi-month High after Dovish Fed
data.text: Investors entered fresh gold longs, as dollar became less popular after the US central bank announced widely expected 25 basis points hike, but the markets took the latest decision as signal that the Fed is nearing its tightening cycle.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds steady near multi-month peak, above $1,950 level
data.text: Gold price builds on this week's positive move from the $1,900 round-figure mark and scales higher for the third successive day on Thursday. The momentum lifts the XAU/USD to the highest level since April 2022, around the $1,960 area during the first half of the European session, albeit lacks strong follow-through.

data.title: Gold Futures: Green light for further gains
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets left behind four consecutive daily drops and rose by around 6.3K contracts on Wednesday according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume followed suit and increased for the second day in a row, now by around 14.4K contracts.

data.title: XAU/USD Breaks Higher
data.text: Gold surges as the US dollar tumbles across the board post-FOMC. On the daily chart, the precious metal is still grinding the demand-turned-supply zone 1950-1995.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes acceptance above $1,960 to initiate a fresh uptrend
data.text: Gold price is sitting at the best levels seen in the last ten months above $1,950. XAU/USD needs to take out $1,960 resistance for further upside, FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD juggles above $1,950 as risk-on mood loses momentum ahead of US NFP
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is displaying back-and-forth moves in the early London session after a breathtaking rally above the crucial resistance of $1,950.00. The precious metal has turned sideways as the US Dollar Index (DXY) is building a cushion around 100.50.

data.title: Gold Prices Rallied as Markets Kept Betting Against the Fed, Now What?
data.text: Gold prices rallied the most in almost 2 weeks as markets continued to bet against the Federal Reserve. What did Jerome Powell say and what are key levels to watch?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes smooth run-up towards $1,980 – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) grinds near the highest levels since April 2022, making rounds to $1,952-50 during early Thursday. In doing so, the XAU/USD bulls seem to catch a breather after rising the most in a fortnight as markets brace for a few more central banks and the US jobs report.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls cheer Federal Reserve action ahead of United States Nonfarm Payrolls
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) makes rounds to the highest levels since late April 2022, close to $1,955 during the mid-Asian session on Thursday. In doing so, the yellow metal extends the US Federal Reserve (Fed) inspired run-up ahead of other major central bank announcements, as well as the US Nonfarm Payrolls (NFP).

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD
data.text: Gold price shot higher to a fresh bull cycle high on the back of the Federal Reserve's dovish tilt that markets have priced in, smelling a 'Fed-pivot' around the corner, bullish for the Gold price.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD trades volatile around $1920-$1930 post Fed 25 bps hike
data.text: Gold price rises following the US Federal Reserve (Fed) decision to slow the pace of interest rate increases and lifted the Federal Funds rate (FFR) by 25 bps to the 4.50% – 4.75% area. At the time of writing, the XAU/USD is trading volatile but above its opening price, at around the $1920-$1930 range.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD slides below $1930, erasing its earlier gains ahead of FOMC's decision
data.text: Gold price retraces from the day's high and failed to hold to earlier gains after a busy US economic calendar released its first tranche of data, which was worse than estimated. In addition, a soft US Dollar (USD), capped the XAU/USD's fall, while US Treasury bond yields continued to push downwards.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to see a lengthier pause – Credit Suisse
data.text: Gold is having a difficult time gathering further bullish momentum. Economists at Credit Suisse expect the yellow metal to stage a consolidantion phase.

data.title: Dollar Falls after ADP Miss, Gold To Try Breakout ahead of Fed
data.text: Dollar falls broadly after ADP job data missed expectations, while traders await FOMC rate decision. There is no doubt that Fed will hike interest rate by 25bps today and signals that tightening is not finished.

data.title: Surfing the Waves with Gregor Horvat: USDCNH, XAUUSD, XAGUSD & More!
data.text: In today's advanced #ElliottWave analysis, Gregor dives into the five most interesting opportunities for the week ahead! Watch how he analyses #equities, #FXMajors, and #Commodities and discover how he applies EW principles to come up with his amazing forecasts!

data.title: Gold Bulls Look Tired After Strong Run Into 2023
data.text: Gold prices have been a one-way bet for three months, posting gains on a softer Dollar and hopes that the Fed is losing its enthusiasm for interest rate hikes

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra decline not ruled out
data.text: Open interest in golf futures markets shrank for the fourth consecutive session on Tuesday, this time by just 867 contracts according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume, instead, went up by around 34.8K contracts after two daily drops in a row.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD treads water around $1,925 area, all eyes on FOMC
data.text: Gold price struggles to capitalize on the overnight goodish rebound from the $1,900 mark, or a nearly two-week low and edges lower on Wednesday. The XAU/USD remains on the defensive through the first half of the European session and is currently trading just below the $1,925 level.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD could retest $1,900 but buyers may re-emerge, spurring volatility
data.text: Gold price holds its recent range after testing the $1,900 mark on Tuesday. In the view of FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta, XAU/USD appears ‘buy the dips' trade.

data.title: Gold Price Could Surge If It Clears This Hurdle
data.text: The 4-hours chart of XAU/USD indicates that the price gained pace above the $1,912 resistance zone. There was a clear move above the 38.2% Fib retracement level of the downward move from the $1,949 swing high to $1,900 low.
